   - CHECK constraints for round_number
   - UNIQUE constraints for composite keys
   - DEFAULT values for timestamps and status fields
5. Add appropriate indexes for performance optimization:
   - Index on player_name fields for text search
   - Index on event_id fields for joins
   - Index on dg_id fields for player lookups

   - Ensure API routes, settlement service, and trend calculations work with new schema

Example migration script structure:
```sql
-- Create tournaments table
CREATE TABLE tournaments (
  event_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  event_name TEXT NOT NULL,
  course_name TEXT,
  course_par INTEGER DEFAULT 72,
  start_date DATE,
  end_date DATE,
  tour TEXT,
  status TEXT DEFAULT 'upcoming',
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Create player_round_scores table
CREATE TABLE player_round_scores (
  id BIGSERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  event_id INTEGER REFERENCES tournaments(event_id),
  dg_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
  player_name TEXT NOT NULL,
  round_number INTEGER CHECK (round_number BETWEEN 1 AND 4),
  round_score INTEGER,
  position INTEGER,
  holes_completed INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  made_cut BOOLEAN,
  tee_time TIMESTAMP,
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
  UNIQUE(event_id, dg_id, round_number)
);

-- Create indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_player_round_scores_event_id ON player_round_scores(event_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_player_round_scores_dg_id ON player_round_scores(dg_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_player_round_scores_player_name ON player_round_scores(player_name);
```

CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW tournament_leaderboard AS
SELECT 
  tr.event_id,
  t.event_name,
  t.course_name,
  t.course_par,
  tr.dg_id,
  tr.player_name,
  tr.final_position,
  tr.total_score,
  (tr.total_score - (t.course_par * 4)) AS score_to_par,
  tr.made_cut,
  tr.round_1_score,
  tr.round_2_score,
  tr.round_3_score,
  tr.round_4_score,
  p.country
FROM tournament_results tr
JOIN tournaments t ON tr.event_id = t.event_id
LEFT JOIN players p ON tr.dg_id = p.dg_id
WHERE tr.final_position IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY tr.event_id, tr.final_position NULLS LAST;

-- Create materialized view for player performance stats
CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW player_performance_stats AS
SELECT 
  p.dg_id,
  p.name AS player_name,
  COUNT(DISTINCT tr.event_id) AS tournaments_played,
  AVG(tr.total_score) AS avg_total_score,
  MIN(tr.final_position) AS best_finish,
  AVG(CASE WHEN tr.final_position <= 10 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS top10_rate,
  AVG(CASE WHEN tr.final_position <= 20 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS top20_rate,
  AVG(CASE WHEN tr.made_cut THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS made_cut_rate,
  AVG(prs.round_score) AS scoring_average,
  STDDEV(prs.round_score) AS score_stddev
FROM players p
JOIN tournament_results tr ON p.dg_id = tr.dg_id
JOIN player_round_scores prs ON p.dg_id = prs.dg_id AND tr.event_id = prs.event_id
WHERE prs.round_score IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY p.dg_id, p.name
HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT tr.event_id) >= 3;

import psycopg2
import argparse
import time
from datetime import datetime

def perform_maintenance(conn_string, vacuum=True, analyze=True, refresh_views=True):
    conn = psycopg2.connect(conn_string)
    conn.autocommit = True
    cur = conn.cursor()
    
    print(f"[{datetime.now()}] Starting database maintenance...")
    
    if vacuum:
        print(f"[{datetime.now()}] Running VACUUM ANALYZE on main tables...")
        tables = ['tournaments', 'player_round_scores', 'tournament_results', 'players', 'player_advanced_stats']
        for table in tables:
            print(f"  - Vacuuming {table}...")
            start_time = time.time()
            cur.execute(f"VACUUM ANALYZE {table};")
            elapsed = time.time() - start_time
            print(f"    Completed in {elapsed:.2f} seconds")
    
    if analyze:
        print(f"[{datetime.now()}] Running ANALYZE on all tables...")
        cur.execute("ANALYZE;")
    
    if refresh_views:
        print(f"[{datetime.now()}] Refreshing materialized views...")
        start_time = time.time()
        cur.execute("SELECT refresh_materialized_views();")
        elapsed = time.time() - start_time
        print(f"  Completed in {elapsed:.2f} seconds")
    
    # Get table statistics
    print(f"\n[{datetime.now()}] Database statistics:")
    cur.execute("""
        SELECT 
            relname AS table_name,
            n_live_tup AS row_count,
            pg_size_pretty(pg_total_relation_size(relid)) AS total_size
        FROM pg_stat_user_tables
        ORDER BY n_live_tup DESC;
    """)
    
    print("\nTable Statistics:")
    print("{:<30} {:>12} {:>15}".format("Table", "Rows", "Size"))
    print("-" * 60)
    for row in cur.fetchall():
        print("{:<30} {:>12,} {:>15}".format(row[0], row[1], row[2]))
    
    cur.close()
    conn.close()
    print(f"\n[{datetime.now()}] Maintenance completed successfully.")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='Perform database maintenance tasks')
    parser.add_argument('--conn', required=True, help='Database connection string')
    parser.add_argument('--no-vacuum', action='store_true', help='Skip VACUUM operation')
    parser.add_argument('--no-analyze', action='store_true', help='Skip ANALYZE operation')
    parser.add_argument('--no-refresh', action='store_true', help='Skip refreshing materialized views')
    
    args = parser.parse_args()
    perform_maintenance(
        args.conn,
        vacuum=not args.no_vacuum,
        analyze=not args.no_analyze,
        refresh_views=not args.no_refresh
    )
